intro: Melosperma glabra, commonly known as smooth melonseed, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often described as ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and typically have five greenish-white sepals. The fruit is a small, smooth, one-seeded achene that matures in late summer.
